title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON)
Interview Descriptions: it is a very minimal interview process. The university assigns you a class or professor to work with and you don't have much options. Basically you speak with the professor and you either accept or reject.
Interview Questions: what are my teaching and research interests

title: Food Server Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Not much to it. They ask about experience, willingness to learn and customer service skills. Friendly and approachable staff. Free meal. They ask about availability to work and you can start as soon as possible
Interview Questions: What are your hours of availability?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: Friendly interview with 2 people. Made me feel very comfortable and relaxed. Questions were mostly about my past experience. They were quick to get back to me and kept me updated during the hiring process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you handled _____ situation

title: Benefits Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: It was a very simple process. The only issue was the wait time for a response, but that is common with most organizations. The panel interview lead to some great discussions, though unsuccessful this round, the team seemed amazing.
Interview Questions: What are your experiences with the benefits program at your previous employment?

title: HR Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, then got emailed inviting me to an interview that was held virtually. Pretty straightforward, I met with the person who managed the department. We talked for about 30 or 40 minutes. Long time to hear back though, got another job while waiting.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. How do you handle balancing competing priorities?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the lab's professor and shared my interests with him. He asked about my experience and availability, and shared what types of projects were available. It was very easy. My information had to be processed by HR to proceed.
Interview Questions: What software are you familiar with?

title: HR Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my application, I got an email offering a virtual interview. The interview itself was pretty straightforward, mostly situational questions. They took months to get back to me though, at which point I already had another job.
Interview Questions: How do you juggle competing priorities?

title: Online Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: I had one telephone interview where I was asked three behavioural questions. The there was also a question about the use of LEARN, they just want to know if you know anything about how to use it.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with LEARN?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: Not too drawn out, consisted of a presentation/panel interview (presenting previous research findings) and a Plum assessment. I had the opportunity to meet others on the team. Discussion was fairly formal
Interview Questions: To present a research project I had worked on in the past, the findings, impact, etc.

title: Masters Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: The professor I was interviewing with flew me out and funded a hotel stay for me for a few days to facilitate an in-person interview after the initial video call meeting. At the in-person portion, I met with a bunch of students in the group I was interviewing for consecutively and attended a research group meeting at which I talked about research I undertook in my undergrad.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself and describe your research.

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds of interviews. Initial interview with manager, second interview with broader team. Standard one hour length for both through zoom. Interview times were scheduled through an assistant. Very quick process from application to final results. About 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your self. How would you manage conflict?

title: Crew Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: To begin the application process, please submit your resume and indicate your availability through our online portal. Upon review, qualified candidates will be contacted via call or email to schedule a face-to-face interview.
Interview Questions: details about my previous experience was asked

title: Food Services Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: You’ll receive an email from the main manager asking to meet on the campus’s cafeteria. You’ll sit down together for the interview. They’ll ask only a couple of questions, it is mostly the manager telling you what the job is like.
Interview Questions: How many days a week are you able to work?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: It was a very straightforward and simple process. Questions related to knowledge of subject were asked and as per the requirements of course work.  And prior experience academic or otherwise.
Interview Questions: Background in the subject I applied to.

title: Account Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Waterloo in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Very well organized and thought through
Invested time in learning more about my experience and sharing their future goals.  Opportunity to meet and interact with various team members across the organization. Took the time to ensure all of my questions were answered
Interview Questions: How do you navigate change?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: Interview happened via skype with the professor. The professor explained about his group and his research areas first and then  asked me a few question (research related). I could answer all the questions very well since it was in my area of expertise.
Interview Questions: How do you approach a problem

title: Undergrad Co-op Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: Online application through the Question platform. No in person / online real time interview. However, there was an asynchronous behaviour interview. Various school websites prepare the candidate for the interview very well. Needs to complete before the deadline.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a difficulty you encoutered.

title: Undergraduate Computer Science Mentor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions:
The interview is asynchronous, you are presented with several questions, a few minutes to perpare each, then film yourself answering the questions.
The questions could be about personal traits, behavioural questions, and such.
Interview Questions: Please estimate how many gas stations are there in a town of around 2000 people

title: Co-Op Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Waterloo in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: My interview process was pleasant and clear. The interview took 2 rounds and I got to meet up with the people that I actually ended up working with. The interviews were completely online due to covid restrictions and the nature of the position.
Interview Questions: They asked about problem-solving and prior experience.

title: ESQ University Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions:
- Very casual, ice-breaking
-2 time-constraint challenge questions that model camp leader responsibilities, problem-solving skills, original thinking process, and basic knowledge in science, engineering, and technology, instead of typical interview questions like your skills, past experience, character, etc.
Interview Questions: Explain to me as if I'm a 5-year-old about the basics of coding.

title: Full Stack Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: The interview included some behavioural questions and some technical questions. Not bad overall, but expected it to be more organized and fewer people in the interview process during the interview.
Interview Questions: Questions related to Python and some algorithm question

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: They have asked me about the basic knowledge of RF design and what I have done during my studies from bacherlor to the end of master. The questions were about Antenna design, Callibration, and RF components used in phased arrays.
Interview Questions: What is callibration, and why if is necessary in measurement?

title: Digital Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was two rounds.  I did a lot of free work for them since they wanted different forms of marketing (Social media posts, promotional poster, banner, video) The process was definitely fun, it's just the most work I've done for just an interview.  The pay is minimum wage as well so I'm surprised they asked for so much.
Interview Questions: How do you stay up to date with current trends.

title: Isa Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is comfortable. There isnt too many technical questions but a lot of behaviour questions. Interviewer is really friendly and understandable and make the whole process really comfortable.
Interview Questions: Is there anything that you want to try?

title: URA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: Emailed professors stating interest in their work. Then did a 30 min online interview and lab tour. Online interview was with a graduate student.  Focused on previous experience, course work, and future interests.
Interview Questions: Course work and previous research experience

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: It was a quick discussion with the team and with simple questions about past work and undergrad experience. It could also be different for different positions and within or across faculties.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this research?

title: Market Insight Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: For a co-op role, occurred through the university career website. Overall 30 minutes long, happened virtually and there was only one stage. The questions were mostly related to why I would be a good fit for the job.
Interview Questions: How I would go about conducting market research for a specific project.

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: The process was a long one since I had been considered for a good research fellow position. I had two interviews with the research group and one interview with the organization giving the funding.
Interview Questions: Machine learning algorithms for shape optimization

title: Third Class Power Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interview layers. Didn't get the job but helpful and good experience. They were able to give me tips and helpful advice moving forward into other interviews. They were kind and the advice was much appreciated. The advice that I reapply in the future when I have more experience.
Interview Questions: Technical questions and operating procedures

title: Design Team Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Took about 2 weeks to get an interview, you have to meet them in the design bay in e7 where you will sit with a team member and discuss various engineering and interpersonal problems
Interview Questions: What are past teamwork experiences

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: The interview is about 20 minutes, and its all about the behavioral questions such as whats your experience, how you face challenges,  how you help others with their questions... There is no technical questions at all, and they do not questions about your major or what you current study.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself and why you choose to apply this job?

title: User Experience Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions:
3 hour interview consisting of a presentation with open attendance, a panel interview, a one-on-one with a department head, and a one-on-one with the hiring manager, followed by a one hour HR interview, and another one hour interview with the hiring manager.

HR rep insisted on speaking to my current immediate manager as a reference BEFORE extending a written offer; would not accept that it was not common practice and effectively hands in my notice before securing the role. Called me to extend a verbal offer and gave me the weekend to think it over and let them know if I would like to let them speak to my current manager before receiving a written offer, then called me back two hours later to rescind the offer.

If working there is anything like the candidate experience; bullet dodged.
Interview Questions: What is an example of a challenge you faced on this project?

title: Educational Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Single interview with program manager. They provided job and program information. Then asked general work experience questions, followed by personal/motivation questions related to education. Was an entry level position, so minimal technical discussion.
Interview Questions: What interests you about this educational program?

title: Casual Part-time Work Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very Straight forward interview process. Just need to let them know why you want to work at a particular franchisee on campus..say Tim Hortons for example. They would then want to know if you have an open schedule and can work flexible hours .
Interview Questions:
Highlight using examples of your people skills and team-work abilities during the interview.
What would you do if a customer spills a drink ?
Max hours/week that you are legally allowed to work.

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Kitchener, ON) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was very enthusiastic and pleasant, they seemed very passionate about their work and looked forward to working with me. The process itself was straightforward and painless, we mostly talked about my past experiences and what projects I would potentially be working on during the term.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past projects

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Basic and Easy. Straight forward questions about resume and situational question, Usually 3-4 on in the call, might have existing co-ops who would ask their own questions. Review basic interview tips and you should be fine, show awareness of basic software usage and Microsoft products.
Interview Questions: How would you act in this situation

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Absolutely amateur and strange experience. Faced a panel of 8 people via video conference, all asking ridiculous questions in a "gotcha" type of manner. The manager went on and on about how difficult their set up was and how much you needed to know to work there. Not one of them looked happy, enthused or positive about their work. An experience I'll never forget.
Interview Questions: Why did you include line x and x in your code example?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: long and a lot of work - had to prepare a presentation, written component and two interviews. I was a ton of work and feel like they took advantage of ideas for free.
Interview Questions: Who would you have dinner with

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: Great interview, polite interviewer. Asked general questions, some situational. Asked to describe my last experiences, what goals I would pursue, etc. No technical questions. Group interview a day before, providing general information.
Interview Questions: Why do you apply for this position?

title: Full Stack Software Developer Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very easy going, interviewer walked me through the application and what the requirements were and I brainstormed some potential solutions to existing problems. There was no coding requirement in the interview.
Interview Questions: How would I improve the design of their UI?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: The interview took place online and was coordinated through Waterloo works. I got an email the day before telling me how he would proceed. Interviews were schedule at only fifteen minutes.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: Mainly talked about the projects I worked on and how I solved past problems. Then I proceeded to ask some questions about what technologies they used. Then, they talked about what the job entailed and what sort of work I would be doing.
Interview Questions: What was your experience working on projects

title: Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Hyperloop Design Team, 1 interview.
Asked about who I was, why I selected Waterloo but most importantly how I could contribute to the team.
Everyone was super nice and extremely helpful.
Onboarding to the team did not take long at all and everyone was happy to help me. Specifically, the team leads were excited to have me on board. Is this not 30 words?
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
Why did you choose Waterloo?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Members of the lab (Grad Students and Post Doc) basically interviewing the candidate, going through their resume, projects, interests as well as how well the research interests would fit in with the project.
Interview Questions:
Why this lab?
Tell us why you would be a good fit?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: it was a very stressful process, and they did not seem to care all that much. It was just like other interviews from big organizations. Interview questions are pretty standard tho
Interview Questions: why do you want to work for us

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Waterlooworks. Applied through waterlooworks. I submitted a resume, a cover letter, my transcript, and my previous work history. Not too difficult. Interview was over Waterloo's integrated webcam thingy. Good, very good, yuh yuh yuh yuh yuh, lol, yes, good
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself. Give a brief explanation of who you are.

title: Front Desk Assistant (Residence Desk Services) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Fairly casual but a great introduction to the type of work you’d be doing. It is a carousel style interview where there are different stations with tasks or activities and one station where you have an individual interview with a manager.
Interview Questions: What would you do during quiet time at the desk?

title: Masters Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: Technical questions, with a focus on area of research (very detailed but depends on supervisor). Some IQ questions, "normal" questions (greatest achievements, why are you interested in this area of research, previous work experience, goals in future, etc...)
Interview Questions: What are your greatest achievements?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Waterloo in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Sometimes no interview is required for TAs, for example, the teaching assistant marker. Also, overall a great experience with the instructor team. The professors are nice and I prepared a brief self-introduction.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Review your research proposal or statement of purpose. ...
Be prepared to talk about your research interests in detail. ...
Think about your motivation for pursuing a PhD. ...
Read your potential supervisor's work. ...
Familiarize yourself with current scholarship in the field.
Interview Questions: What is the research interest and what are the prospects for the future

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Toronto, ON) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was kind and patient. Asked questions related to the pandemic and how one adapts to the current situations. Also asked soft-skill based questions and took some  time to explain the role and it's responsibilities
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
What are the benefits and disadvantages of working at home?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: The professor asked a few questions about my professional skills and experience.  She then introduced me to the work and responsibility of a TA. The interview lasted about 15 minutes and was nice.
Interview Questions: What course have you enrolled in previously and currently,

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was held with all members of hiring team which was nice as they wouldn’t then need to conduct 3 separate rounds. It lasted about an hour and never felt like one was “grilled” although team there is very thorough.
Interview Questions: What do you know about our department.

title: Front Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: It was a 2-hour long carousel interview with 6 stations. One had a group discussion, role-playing, decision making, ice breaker discussions and a personal interview. It was fairly easy and makes sure you know how to handle customers.
Interview Questions: Time management skills and customer service skills were asked

title: faculty relations manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was relatively quick from application to being scheduled for an interview (maybe within 1-2 weeks, I was contacted). I was booked into a panel interview with three panelists (prospective manager and two faculty contacts). There were alternating behavioural-based questions. Although I did not progress to the next stage, I appreciated receiving a phone call to let me know and to discuss feedback from the interview.  The manager was very kind and supportive and left a positive impression.
Interview Questions: What would be your biggest strength and weakness coming into the role?

title: HRIS Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON)
Interview Descriptions: resume, interview in front of a panel and hope for the best. My experience was not standard because i was referred by a friend who knew someone in HR. That is all I have to say!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: SPO Advancement Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: 2 stage interview process. 1 for technical proficiency another for cultural fit. Straightforward calls and in-person interviews. I wasn't asked too many difficult questions and they were pretty direct and honest
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths? 
How do you handle multitasking? etc

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I would say the interview is very simple and fast and the professors there are really really nice to communicate. So, be yourself and do your best would be fine
Interview Questions: why do you like to work at uwaterloo

title: Community Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was very warm and welcoming.  The interview takes 40 - 60 min. Whether you are selected or rejected, you can hear back from the interview process after a week or two.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself / tell me about yourself?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: my interview was about 30 minutes. first, the professor asked me general questions like where I studied what was my research on. then he asked me more about the subject of my thesis.
Interview Questions: why do you want to do your Ph.D. here?

title: Talent Acquisition Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through the University of Waterloo website and received an in person interview at the University of Waterloo. The interview lasted about 30 minutes and I found out the results a month later.
Interview Questions: What made you interested in the job?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: I am not sure whether we have an interview before we became the research assistant. Each graduate student could have a part time job at the campus either as a research assistant or teaching assistant.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: Met with manager and faculty for in person interview. Standard questions based on role. HR handles offer but departments oversee specific hiring. Overall process took a few weeks. The interview took approximately up minutes.
Interview Questions: Name a time you disagreed with a coworker

title: Communications/Media Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was invited for an in person interview a couple of weeks after applying. It was a panel interview with the hiring manager and another team member. Before getting into their questions, they asked if I had any questions about the role which I really appreciated. All of the questions they asked were very specific to the role and my experience. They answered all of my questions (and I had a lot) and seemed very passionate about their jobs and the university. I had a second follow up phone interview with HR that was more behavioural questions. Everyone was really transparent about the hiring process and next steps.
Interview Questions: What type of person/personality do you find most difficult to work with?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON)
Interview Descriptions: it takes about two sessions technical questions from the prof and questions regarding your career goal and future plans  your resume is important and your reference letter from previous supervisor or professor
Interview Questions: what is your future plan?

title: Data Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Received and email inviting to interview (4 day notice), asked for alternative time slot since it was difficult to get the time off at the current job, I was refused an alternative time.  I made it work, after interview request for references was received within 3 days (3 references requested including 1st to be current employer) I sent along all references, asking if current employer would be left out of contact or at least a heads-up for when they would to allow for me to have 'that' conversation with current employer. UW HR did not give me notice or courtesy of doing so, contacted my employer same day. Received an offer 2 weeks later.
Interview Questions: Experience with R/ Rstudio, statistical software or multiple OS? Combined with customer service academic experience with researchers/students?

title: Accounting Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very standard interview. It consisted of the typical behavioural and situational type questions. For example, "tell me about a time when....", "how to you handle 'x' types of situations...", "tell me about yourself..." etc etc
Interview Questions: I was given a list of things to do in Excel and 8 minutes to complete it

title: Digital Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Before an initial phone or in-person interview the hiring contact in the marketing department asked candidates to do a "design project". 

Work for free (without proper context IMO) developing marketing material, and a marketing plan. Only IF your "project" was to their liking, would they bring you in for a interview. To distill this down...the candidates time is worth less than the interviewers  time.  

I made the mistake of working for free in this case and tested my luck. I got burnt. Apparently they were "impressed" by my free work, but I was not worthy of their precious interview time. 

Waterloo University Marketing department owes me and the other candidates (including whoever was offered the job) a fair freelance hourly rate for the hours of work we put in. 

How a top university in this country engages in such unethical interview practices is beyond me. I hope you at least put my free work to good use...

To clarify further, a design test can be appropriate in certain interview settings. But you can't take advantage of people and ask them to work for free.
Interview Questions: Didn't ask me a single question. Wanted several hours of work from me though.

title: EMR Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: a panel of 3 people, they asked standard quesitons like tell me about yourself, why do you want to here , etc. THey were chilled at the beginning and then got a little bit serious at the end
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Isa Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: Applied via Waterlooworks. Then interviewed with future supervisor. After the interview we waited for a few weeks till the matching day on which we see our rank from the employer and give our rank to the employer.
Interview Questions: What motivates you to wake up in the morning?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: applied through the University website and got an email to come for an interview. She asked general interview questions such as why you want this job, experiences you have in the past.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Computer Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Waterloo in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: there are three online questions on the portal. Each question provides 1-2 min preparation time. After you answer the first two questions, you are asked to write a short essay.
Interview Questions: how do you show your leadership

title: Community Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I was asked to give a presentation on one of the topics from the list: Conflict Management, Educational Programming, Student Development Theory, 
Team Building, Time Management, Relationship Building. The presentation was 30 mins and 15 mins chat.
Interview Questions: What would the previous supervisor describe you?

title: Undergraduate Services Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: A series of questions were asked ranging from specific information on my resume to scenarios using soft skills and technical skills. Interviewers made notes while I was answering which took some nerve off, but there were many questions prepared. They were all tailored to the position which involved customer service, organizations, and problem solving.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with confidential information?

title: Co-Op Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: They ask you a lot of scenario based questions and that's mostly it. You could have multiple people interviewing you at once so make sure you know how to address multiple people in an interview while answering the question that is posed to you. Another thing is they offer you food. GRAB SOME! don't be shy. The work environment, if you get the job you'll learn is great and filled with people that want to support you. Perhaps go through some scenario questions. Ask yourself how you multitask. How you work in teams, how you take notes. I personally feel like employers can tell when you're making up a story. So be yourself. I know its cliche but it's so true.
Interview Questions: How would you handle being given 2 projects that have high importance and are bot due on the same day from different supervisors?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was great. The posting was provided on the university website and I applied. I got an email days later to confirm that had an Interview. I was excited
Interview Questions: Why do you want to teach this subject?

title: Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON)
Interview Descriptions: One face to face interview with HR present. Structured question and answer. Pretty standard questions. Online prerequisites are filtered by Human Resources before being handed to employer for consideration. Jobs are posted internally before external and may already have an internal candidate on staff moving from contract to full time status
Interview Questions: N/A

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: You just have to apply online, so no interview process. You will get back from the dept. coordinator if you;re selected for the position a two to three weeks before the term starts.

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: teach students, mainly help teachers marking,  hold tutorials, and answer students  questions if they cannot understand any problem. It is a very good experience because you can learn a lot from teaching others.
Interview Questions: Did you learn this leson before?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: firstly, you should apply for master in Waterloo. The TA positions are mainly for research-based student, and you have to get a minimum of 80 to have the right to become a TA in university of Waterloo
Interview Questions: which courses do you want to take part in

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed for a specific lab. The staff was very friendly and resourceful. I even asked her why she chose to work here (I do not suggest you to ask this type of questions thou)
Interview Questions: what you have any experience as a RA?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: A brief interview with the prof. Asked a few questions about academic background, GPA, courses and related software skills. Simple in-person interview. Discussed the potential salary for the research project.
Interview Questions: Did you have any previous work experience in Website programming?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: There were two sets of interviews. The first interview was with an HR Manager and the second interview was with the hiring manager and other members of the department.  The interviews took place in person and this was pre-COVID.
Interview Questions: Standard questions about your current job and behavioural questions were part of the interview with the hiring manager.

title: Undergraduate Researcher Coop Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Length was 45 minutes. The professor was really nice and understanding. Research a lot on the professor and his own research before going into the interview. Grades are really important when it comes to getting a Research position.
Interview Questions: Why should I employ you?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I emailed the professor. They replied back and we set up a time to meet. Then we took a tour of the lab. Afterwards,  he asked questions and then said he needed some time to think about it.
Interview Questions: Describe your past experiences.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed directly with the professor. My academic record was asked for, and I was tested on my knowledge of the subject by being asked specific questions that related to the optics and biomedical imaging field.
Interview Questions: How would you correct for an airy disk diffraction pattern when imaging on our microscope?

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Asked to schedule a prescreen.  

Recruiter was almost 10 minutes late to the call.

I would have declined this role had I been offered it.  

The compensation outlined was not in line with what was advertised, and it was under my current compensation.  

One of the only questions asked was "Read me back the job description and tell me how you think your skills will apply to each of the responsibilities listed. "  Which as a recruiter is an extremely lazy method of skills assessment, actually had to the interviewer to repeat the question.

No questions were asked pertaining to my functional recruitment skills.  As a recruiter, that's absolutely paramount.  

This was one of, if not THE top employer in the region I was looking at.  I'm woefully disappointed in how this played out, and the experience absolutely removed them from my list of potential employers for at least the foreseeable future.  

Good luck hiring top talent with this method of screening.
Interview Questions: Read me back the job description and tell me how you think your skills will apply to each of the responsibilities listed.

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: This was for a job at the TC center. It was easy and fun. I was interviewed by this lovely lady and the person that would be leaving this job. They asked me to type a tweet for their interview skills workshop on Word.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you were in a difficult situation and how did you deal with it.

title: Front Desk Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Pretty chill, participants are quite competitive. Be well prepared, since people are energetic (?), you might get overwhelmed and stuttered like crazy (like I did). It’s not too difficult though, so be confident as much as you could :)
Interview Questions: Have you ever been in a situation of bad customer service? What would you do if you were them?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was done in several different steps, first in person interview by 2 people, then another in person interview with another 2 people, several phone conversations/emails, a phone interview with HR, followed by a phone offer and online offer for the position with 1 week to accept.
Interview Questions: Is it better to be perfect at your job and late for work, or on time for work and mediocre at your job

title: Undergraduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: It is a very short video interview. There are only two questions which last about 2 minutes. You only need a PC with microphone and camera. Be confident and just show who you are!
Interview Questions: Why you are interested in this program

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Mostly talking about the campus and program. Talking about the background and strength and weaknesses. Describe your background and publication. Also, there where some questions about teaching experience. Also, talk about your research plan and future strategies
Interview Questions: why uwaterloo?

title: Graduate Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Reached out to supervisor via email. Received a response via email approximately one month after applying. Was invited for an interview within one week. After the interview, received a response within a week.
Interview Questions: They asked about career goals, experience in my field and my soft skills (handling conflict, time management, work life balance etc). They asked what I would like to achieve working in this position. There was also two brain teaser questions.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: After submitting application you will be contacted by the Professor asking for your experience and qualifications. Try to target classes where you have the necessary experience. It helps if you know the Professor from before and have established a good relationship with them as there are a lot of students applying for TAships.
Interview Questions: What do you know about this software(Quartus) and VHDL that is used in this course?

title: Client Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: 2 to 1, lasted for around 30 minutes, there are no tough questions. They went through the responsibilites to make sure you meet their requirements. And also some behavioural questions. The interviewers are kind.
Interview Questions: behavioural and related field questions

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Waterloo in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone Interview that lasted a brief call as scheduled over email, the whole thing lasted about 15 minutes, interviewer was very friendly but to the point and also went over job expectatitons which was helpful
Interview Questions: How do you make a first impression with potential participants

title: PDF Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Waterloo in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was online on the skype I had to give a presentation about my previous work which I did during my PhD. We connected and I gave the presentation and everything else went on smooth. It depends upon your supervisor what kind of question he/she will ask you.
Interview Questions: Discussion of previous work

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview, because I'm already a student and there are looking for the CV only. from your CV they will judge either you are fit for this position or not.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Lab Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: it was a face to face interview. The course coordinator invited me for a 30 minutes conversation and the talk was very friendly and easy to answer. Basic knowledge on theory and little bit of coding based questions were asked.
Interview Questions: VHDL coding, Microcontroller knowledge

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Very professional, fast, very nice people and respectful. Great questions great place great time . Long interview but expected. Enjoyed mock lecture. Fantastic classroom. Super nice committee people and good questions to be asked
Overall very well and amazing
Interview Questions: How unique your teaching is?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Well informed and rigorous without being intimidating. The interviewer had many question. Prep needed regarding the university as an institution was necessary to answer all of the questions. Situation was a little awkward because I was going from a teacher position internally to a different position so I was privy to a lot of the back end hiring decision.
Interview Questions: How can you adhere to the policies at the University of Waterloo and make sure they are fulfilled?

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Simple and friendly, great staff that asked questions about the job that I was applying for that day. It was a process for sure. Definitely a great place to look at.
Interview Questions: Greatest weakness that you have

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was good. i was asked questions regarding my prior experiences and how i think i fit the role . You’ll also enjoy significant opportunities to grow your career through leadership training, organizational development workshops and secondments
Interview Questions: they asked me why i want to work for the university

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: There were just easy to medium questions to the interview. The environment is really friendly. And the location is great. I graduated from university of Waterloo. The overall process was really good.
Interview Questions: How many years of experience do you have with this role.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied through my university, interview takes place at the university, it was a 1 to 1 interview,  the whole process takes around 1 week, I accepted the  in the end
Interview Questions: Can you describe distillation process in detail?

title: Coordinator, Library Accessibility Services & AODA Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was a full day from 9:00-4:00 p.m. I had to do a 20-minute presentation in front of the faculty and I was invited to have lunch with the hiring panel on campus.  The presentation topic was the following: The Library is always looking for ways to be more accessible in terms of their services, resources and spaces.  Please prepare and present a 20- minute session addressing the following topic: Please discuss the key factors in increasing the virtual and physical accessibility of library resources and services? 

The interview was very well organized and an overall positive experience until I was ghosted after finding out that I did not get the position. I had driven three hours to go to the interview and was told that I would be compensated for travel. I was also told that I could call the hiring manager to receive feedback. I left a voicemail and sent a follow-up email after not hearing back for two weeks. I was never contacted and I never received feedback or compensation for my travel expenses.
Interview Questions: What is universal design? Can you provide an example?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: They had me write a web application. They gave me a rough specification and let me loose from there. I needed to figure out the details myself. I had Friday-Monday afternoon to get it done. They also had me review a research paper.
Interview Questions: Choose a research paper in the area and give 3 things you like and 3 things you dislike about the paper.

title: Gene 121 TA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I wa really simple. you just apply on job mine and wait for an interview. then the ranking process. ant that is pretty much it. During the interview they just ask you trivial questions and also to code some simple stuff.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a student is struggling with some piece of code?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Pretty relaxed overall process, not too many difficult questions as they're looking for students to work a part time desk job, shouldn't be too difficult as the questions are straightforward, only need to be available throughout the term for at least 8hrs at least one day of the week.
Interview Questions: How available are you?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied through email and Jobmine. Process took a week or so. Was contacted through email and was told to drop in at listed times. Knock upon arrival. Was a casual 10 min interview in a lab. Very simple and direct. No need for formality which was nice.
Interview Questions: What equipment do you know how to use? -Shows you around the lab-

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied through email and Jobmine. Process took a week or so. Was contacted through email and was told to drop in at listed times. Knock upon arrival. Was a casual 10 min interview in a lab. Very simple and direct. No need for formality which was nice.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself?

title: Exam Proctor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON)
Interview Descriptions: No interview, N/A, you just need to apply and you will have to select a day for training. You get pay as well on the training. Anyone can apply to be an exam proctor. Overall the process was smooth
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: There was a panel interview with three interviewers which I had over Skype for an hour since I was out-of-province. The staff were very approachable, friendly, and easy to speak with.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: Residence Life Don Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through LEADS and heard back from them within a week. The interviews consisted of two parts: a carousel-style interview (individual) and group work. During the carousel-style interview, you go around to the various tables where someone will ask you one question. You have a certain amount of time to answer the questions. The group component was to see how well you work with other individuals when planning events.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were "Tell me a time when you..." They want you to talk about your past experiences and how it relates to being a Don

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Thorough and concise.  99% of technical questions, mostly aptitude based ones.
Was given hints in case of trick questions, often found them helpful.
Also, I felt it best to admit my lack of expertise in answering one of the questions, the interviewer totally moved on and didn't dwell on it.
Interview Questions: What do you hope to accomplish as a graduate student?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is standard. There are lot of questions related to the position you applied to but they are fairly easy and there are no trick questions. There are also scenario questions, the tip is to use real life examples, they are the best. The interview is usually one on one since it is a junior position and he or she is most likely your future supervisor if you get the job. It feels like a conversation.
Interview Questions: How would you cope with multiple deadlines?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: No general interview process for postdocs. This will depend on your speciality. Your supervisor would have already reviewed your resume and will ask you questions based on your past research. You might be required to do a presentation or do a guest lecture at the university to see if you can teach. Sometimes you will talk to the dean or the department director. No general interview process for postdocs. This will depend on your speciality. Your supervisor would have already reviewed your resume and will ask you questions based on your past research. You might be required to do a presentation or do a guest lecture at the university to see if you can teach. Sometimes you will talk to the dean or the department director. No general interview process for postdocs. This will depend on your speciality. Your supervisor would have already reviewed your resume and will ask you questions based on your past research. You might be required to do a presentation or do a guest lecture at the university to see if you can teach. Sometimes you will talk to the dean or the department director.
Interview Questions: When can you start?

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON)
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position of Project Assistant. I got the interview call in 3 days. During the interview I got the impression that I will be given this task.
Interview Questions: Just basic question, hobbies, extra curricular activites

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Contacted by professor after applying for masters degree, was interviewed over the phone, received offer shortly afterwards, went over my CV and general background, discussed projects and then was asked a few networks questions

The idea for university graduate admissions is to try and reach out to professors with matching interests and look for a project for which they may fund you, generally if you have a solid background and a matching project, it is likely you will be selected
Interview Questions: Describe the differences between DCTCP vs TCP? What is the network stack?

title: Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Brief interview. Met with three team members. Professional, but very conversation-like. Was given a take-home writing assignment, to write a sample article/promotional piece and send within a few days. Moved very quickly.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you dealt with conflict in the workplace.

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted through email for an in-person interview. Interviewed by a peer and the person I would be reporting to. Interview was very stiff, questions read off of a sheet, so no matter what the answer the next question was already set. It made for a very awkward interview with a lot of repetition. No natural or lead opportunity to discuss what I could offer outside of their questionnaire, so they were looking for a candidate who was more of a box checker, very inside-the-lines for a marketing position. The interview ended with a 20 minute essay style test on a computer that didn't have a functioning keyboard. The whole thing was pretty awkward. I followed up afterwards to thank them and didn't get a response, and then followed up after not hearing from them for 3 weeks to ask for an update. The response was "hi, this position's been filled, thanks." Which felt thoughtless and unprofessional, but kept to the tone of the interview. People seemed nice enough, maybe a little dry and process driven. I did not receive an offer, and although I would have taken the role as something for the meantime, I would have left as soon as something more interesting came along so I'll concede that it wasn't a fit and I ain't mad.

Prepare yourself for a similar interview by googling "interview questions" and there won't be any surprises.
Interview Questions: Standard questions like, name your 3 best qualities and why?

title: Customer Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON)
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for the RCSG team and the interview process was fairly relaxed. The manager just had a short casual conversation, talked about university and how long he has been there. He asked if I have OSAP and he pretty much okayed me on the spot.
Interview Questions: How much do you know about computers?

title: Undergrad TA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: Work study position, applied for through online system and when granted, met with Department Head. I was in a small program, so prof knew me well and knew my work ethic and abilities.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Very informal discussions with doctoral supervisor to continue research and finish publications. It was a very brief interview to determine what additional responsibilities could be added to previous tasks done during degree completion.
Interview Questions: What is the next journal you plan to submit to?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very normal, not tough, no questions on subject matter. Asked on previous experience. About the scholarships received. About my future plans. About the number of projects managed. About family, about relocation.
Interview Questions: Years of experience

title: Marker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview. You just submit your application form. And people from the university will decide whether or not you could work as a marker or tutor. It is easy if you have very high previous GPA.
Interview Questions: Have you ever been a TA before?

title: Manager, Partnerships Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a two stage interview. The HR interview was first with basic behavioral questions. It took approximately 45 minutes. The second interview included a panel of 3, who took turns asking questions. The questions were focused on past experience addressing the requirements of the new job.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years. Describe a time when you did not get along with a colleague

title: Entrepreneur In Training Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was a group interview process which was just a bit of an info session to the position. I was asked the typical behavioral questions, my background in working with technology, as well as interest in entrepreneurship.
Interview Questions: How would you resolve an issue between a coworker?

title: Records Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Had an interview after 7 months of applying (already on contract in position), Interview 6 weeks ago and still haven't had a response. Interview was very thorough, have to have experience working in records (although no experience is required as long as you can maneuver around a computer). Interview takes place with HR rep and Plant Operations supervisor, lasted about an hour, probably 20 questions, fairly standard interview questions.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to have very strong attention to detail

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a panel of 3-4 people, where they all took turns asking questions and going over my resume. The interview was scheduled to be half an hour long, but it went on longer.
Interview Questions: What group project and solo project experience do you have?

title: Front Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to fill out a form before going into the interview room. The interview is very form. One person is asking the question and the other one was sitting there and recording all of the answers you gave to them.
Interview Questions: What is the most difficult time of your life? How did you get through it?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: Well, for a postdoc position, I got a chance to come to Waterloo, just for an interview. The interview included a talk about my research as well as one-on-one meeting with every member in the research group. It took almost a whole day, but it was not so tough.
Interview Questions: The questions were mostly about my research, so I did not find one of them much more challenging than others to answer.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: the interview was quick and sample. the question were focused on the my background and skills and how i can use these skills to be successful in the position.  Good ambiance
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Waterloo in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: call with the supervisor for 3 times,and a lot of email communication. Then got the oral offer, and after about 2 weeks, the official offer from university of waterloo came.
Interview Questions: how long in this area

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It's a challenge to get a foot in the door at the University of Waterloo.  I was able to get into the roster for job offers when I had submitted my resume and qualifications at a local temporary employment agency.  After having nearly a year working temporarily, I finally had enough experience to apply for jobs on campus.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions, with the challenging 'name your weaknesses' question.

title: Computer Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Employer explained about the activities of the job and showed around the computer lab that I will be working on. The interview was supposed to be 30 minutes but it ended up being about an hour.
Interview Questions: Mostly behavioural questions

title: Website Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions:
Phone Interview, and the phone call lasted for 30 minutes.

I declined the offer as it does not fit in my career goal. The reason of applying this position is solely practice my interview skills, but website development is not what I am looking for as I am not a very good programmer. In addition, the pay does not cover all of the expenses in Waterloo as a student.
Interview Questions: 1) Why do you like to work at the university?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, QC) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Quick meeting with the supervisor with a quick rundown of the job. The supervisor then asked me a few questions about what i knew in the field of microfabrication and described the work being done in further detail.
Interview Questions: Q: What do you know about microfabrication?

title: Mechanical Engineering Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Toronto, ON) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Submit high school transcript and AIF form, get offer if you meet the criteria. I applied through OUAC. I don't work there per se, I'm a co op student. You need a higher average to get into the co-op program. Engineering is co-op only.
Interview Questions: What's the last book you read?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: An interview held at the University of Waterloo, in person for 20 mins. The interview was very short and lasted around 20 minutes. An interview held at the University of Waterloo, in person for 20 mins. The interview was very short and lasted around 20 minutes.
Interview Questions: What is your weakness?

title: Residence Life Don Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: Apply to their website and receive a response a week after the submission deadline.
Interview Questions: Just be positive and show that you love helping people. Also come up with ideas for future events you would like to hold.

title: TPA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Really easy super friendly.  There is an interview panel, usually with students who are already in the job. That is fine though because they are good at hiring, so everyone is super nice!
Interview Questions: Basic questions: "What would you do in this situation or that situation"

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Toronto, ON) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The professor will send you an email to ask you whether you are available to chat over skype, then you can decide a time slot which is available for both you and the professor. Just introduce what you have done to him, and remember, don't be nervous.
Interview Questions: What have you ever done? Introduce you research experience. Something like this.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: There actually is no interview. you submit an application per course and you rank your courses. The professor will them review all candidates and rank them as well. Then the department will match the professor's ranking with that of the candidate. However, it helps a lot if you go talk to the professor beforehand and show interest in being his or her TA
Interview Questions: Questions regarding previous Teaching experience

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions:
it was great got the job! the meeting was quick and short
we spent most of the time discussing my thesis research 
the professors are really kind and supportive
i went home and got a call 2 days later that I got the job
overall make sure you have excellent writing and speaking skills and is really interested in  the research not just for the money
Interview Questions:
can you manage your time 
can you meet deadlines
the writing and speaking potential

title: Co-op Alumni Advancement Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: One half hour interview in-person with supervisor, followed by a 10 minute Excel proficiency test.
Interview Questions: Personality/Problem-solving questions

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: Just need to make sure you know the professor well, there is no interview needed. However you need a good academic record.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work as a grad student.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: just basic questions and my personal preference
Interview Questions: run tutorial or not

title: Special Projects Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: Through jobmine, the process was fairly easy where the interview time, location and everything was set through the system. The interview process was simple where the supervisor would ask the standard questions, what made you apply, what you are looking for from the experience, etc. Be fully prepared and everything will go smoothly
Interview Questions: Are you funny?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON)
Interview Descriptions: It was simple and straight forward. They told me straight away what the project is and what skills they are looking for. And asking me what can i do for them.
Interview Questions: Explain the extent of my knowledge for specific coding language.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward. I was interviewed by a professor. Questions about academic and any extracurricular activities I was involved in.
Interview Questions: What part of your professional life as a student would you change and why?

title: Front Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: there was an interview carousel where you rotated to different stations. One station involved role play which was a situational based question. Another station was a group panel discussion. Another station included 1 on 1 interview with management.
Interview Questions: They asked about time management skills

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
