Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied to University Portal and was called for the interview. It took almost 2 weeks to hear from the lab supervisor. Proper training was given prior to lab sessions :)
Interview Questions: Prior experience?

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions:
One interview with the employer who would be the individual I directly reported to with behavioural questions and questions regarding prior experiences relevant to the role at hand.
Interview featured background information on the role and background on certain confidential portions of the tasks which would be part of the individual’s duties
Interview Questions: Discuss one time you produced a creative piece of work and how you managed feedback received on the process

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Casual at first as it was a contract.  If you apply for a contract job, the process seems a little less intimidating.  If full time job permanent, that is a different mindset.
Interview Questions:
Situational and many questions about give me an example of ...
Also many behavioral questions, what would you do in the case of...

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Toronto, ON) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: A panel interview with two of the ops team members. Their interview questions weren't great. For one, they seemed really overly concerned about educational background/experience and didn't really seem receptive to candidates without a Research Analyst post-grad certificate, which totally put a damper on the experience. I don't even know why they interviewed me in the first place, given how put off they were by my choice of undergrad major. Just weird, incredulous grilling me on my resume details. There weren't any real competency-based questions, and they weren't easy to establish a rapport with. I usually find people who are interviewing me to be likeable, but they didn't come across as easy people to work with.
Interview Questions: If I am comfortable with staying past regular work hours to finish a task.

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Basically talk about your plan of your research work
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Instructional Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I saw the posting on their website and then I applied through email and received a response back from the interviewer with information about where to go for my interview a week later. I met with 3 people for the interview which lasted about 1 hour. I then heard back a few weeks later with their decision.
Interview Questions: How would you handle upset professors or lecturers when it comes to creating their content?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Waterloo in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: First you have to contact the professor through email and let him know about your experience and academic background in the related field. After that if professor is satisfied with you, he will most probably would like to interview you on skype. Mostly he asks technical questions.
Interview Questions: Its not that hard if you know the basics

title: Events and Outreach Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Very friendly interview, one interview and will be chosen through Jobmine. 
Constant email communication between supervisor before and after interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us when you had to negotiate tasks under a stressful situation and tell us how and why you handled it that way.

title: WatPD Marking Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: I went in for a one on one interview, was asked basically questions about my teaching strength, preferences, and experience. The interviewer filled out a form during the process. After that, I was placed in an empty room and asked to proofread an Engineering term report; I had to mark it up with corrections and suggestions. I wasn't given a time limit, but I'd estimate it took me 20 minutes or so. I had no idea in advance I would have to do this.
Interview Questions: Please proofread this Engineering term report (several pages) for English and stylistic errors. Make positive suggestions for the student.

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Got a phone call from one of the supervisor. Came in person for an interview. It was about an hour long mainly focusing on my ability to study and work in the same term. After that, I received a phone call that offered me the job. I came back and trained with other applicants for 2 days then started immediately in the next week. The whole process took less than a month.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? What program are you in UW? What courses are you taking this term?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Iniital screening by resume and then a couple of interview by your prospective graduate advisors. 
interview was pretty informal and you were just asked what you know about a parituclar field,, no home assignment or anything else.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to Waterloo

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Couple of engineering questions, depends on the faculty member who interviews you. Some of them ask hard question related to their specific field. Don't worry if you don't know the exact answer, they want to see how you approach the problem.
Interview Questions: Telecommunication stuff, information technology, past experience and so on

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview first; if passed, flowed by on-site 1:1 interview; if passed, job offer will come.
Interview Questions: Reverse the word sequence in a string

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Waterloo, ON) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: There will be one I interview before the hiring and it is mostly luck of the draw. There is a lot of internal promotion and external recruiting.
Interview Questions: How do you resolve a conflict between two people if you do not understand the problem.

title: Sys Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Waterloo (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: 2 Strings each take 1/2 hr long to burn out at unknown rate , how do you time 45 min?
Interview Questions: 2 Strings each take 1/2 hr long to burn out at unknown rate , how do you time 45 min?
